Access functions

Detailed Description

Functions for getting and setting data in objects.


Functions

Value GetSlot (Value array, int index)
 Gets an array slot's value.

void SetSlot (Value array, int index, Value newValue)
 Sets an array slot's value.

Value GetSlot (Value frame, Value tag)
 Gets a frame slot's value.

void SetSlot (Value frame, Value tag, Value newValue)
 Sets a frame slot's value.

void RemoveSlot (Value frame, Value tag)
 Removes a frame slot.

bool HasSlot (Value frame, Value tag)
 Tests existence of a frame slot.

Value GetPath (Value obj, Value path)
 Gets a slot value determined by a path expression.

void SetPath (Value obj, Value path, Value newValue)
 Sets the value of a slot determined by a path expression.

bool HasPath (Value obj, Value path)
 Tests existence of a slot determined by a path expression.

void * GetData (Value binary)
 Gets a pointer to the beginning of a binary object's data.

Value GetClassSlot (Value obj)
 Gets the value of an object's class slot.

void SetClassSlot (Value obj, Value cls)
 Sets the value of an object's class slot.

void AddArraySlot (Value array, Value newValue)
 Extends an array by one slot.

Value * GetArraySlots (Value array)
 Gets a pointer to an array's slots.

int GetArrayLength (Value array)
 Gets the numbers of slots in an array.

void SetArrayLength (Value array, int nSlots)
 Sets the number of slots in an array.

int GetBinaryLength (Value binary)
 Gets the number of bytes in a Binary object.

void SetBinaryLength (Value binary, int size)
 Sets the number of bytes in a Binary object.

int GetObjLength (Value obj)
 Returns the length of any object, in bytes for binary objects, in slots for frames and arrays.

Value Clone (Value obj)
 Clones an object (shallowly).

Value DeepClone (Value obj)
 Clones an object (deeply).

void ReplaceObject (Value oldObj, Value newObj)
 Causes all references to oldObj to refer to newObj instead.
